name: Idiopathic Retroperitoneal Fibrosis with Ureteral Obstruction
chief_complaint: Severe flank pain and difficulty urinating
prognosis: Variable; depends on early diagnosis and treatment. Progressive renal failure may occur if untreated.
description: A rare inflammatory condition characterized by fibrotic tissue proliferation in the retroperitoneum, often encasing and compressing the ureters. Etiology is unknown in idiopathic cases (Ormond's disease), though secondary forms may relate to malignancies, infections, or certain medications. Diagnosis typically requires CT/MRI and often biopsy to rule out malignancy.
